column1: What did you think about the use of VR in these stories what part of the story stood out to you want to answer first?

Um...the few parts that stood out to me.... it all strories we did often or all day. And VR used in a lot of aspects of your day and that sometimes in the video said it was hard to get out off it. A mother asked a few times to get them to dinner.
I do like how they connect a large audience people.
That would be cool. what kind of problems do you think VR might create for you as a kid?
that makes sense aside which we aren't experiences are good choice for children
Who do you think shoul decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
And the last question when VR makers are creating VR experience for children and families what are some of the important things?
Keep it approporate and not too addictive.
Is there anything else you guys want to share about your experience in VR
Feel free to grab a stuffed animal from right there.
